news.title: ‘Thank you Ireland’ – Volodymyr Zelensky addresses the Dáil and tells TDs and senators: ‘Help us achieve real peace’
Boyfriend of Louth crash victim Chloe Hipson was set to propose on Christmas Eve, mourners told
news.summary: A young Scottish student killed in a crash in Co Louth which claimed five lives has been remembered as the "most perfect" member of her family, who was "thriving" while living abroad.

news.title: Couple withdraw €120,000 damages claims after judge is shown honeymoon photos of them on waterslides and jeep safari
news.summary: A honeymoon photo album posted on Facebook by a newlywed couple proved their downfall today when it was used against them to successfully defend their bid to recover €120,000 damages for personal injuries.

news.title: Abuse survivors say former Willow Park teacher was 'one cog in a machine of abuse' as he faces sentencing
news.summary: A former teacher will be sentenced next week for the indecent assault of eight boys over 30 years ago at a private Dublin school.

news.title: Ireland’s Mack Hansen a major doubt for Six Nations after undergoing surgery on foot
news.summary: Mack Hansen has emerged as a serious doubt for the Six Nations after undergoing surgery for a troublesome foot injury.

news.title: TikTok and LinkedIn to be investigated by Irish media regulator
news.summary: The media regulator has launched an investigation into whether TikTok and LinkedIn allow their users to report suspected child sexual abuse material anonymously.

news.title: ‘There’s no event like the Carrick Winter Fair. I’ve never experienced anything else close to it’
news.summary: A silence so complete you could hear a penny drop. And then the hammer fell: €33,500, the kind of money that once belonged only in pedigree sales, not a commercial ring.

news.title: Nephew wins out in High Court battle over Carlow bachelor farmer’s will
news.summary: The High Court has resolved a bitter family dispute over the will of a Carlow bachelor farmer, ruling that the deceased intended to leave his entire 69ac landholding to his nephew, who had worked the farm for decades.

news.title: Meet the Leitrim woman who swapped living on Dublin’s O’Connell Street for a 100-year-old farmhouse and a six hour daily commute
news.summary: After eight years of city centre living on O’Connell Street, Martha Gilheaney is now in the middle of making a rural 100-year-old Leitrim farmhouse her home.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: Like many things that are overhyped, Gloria Osteria’s ‘incomparable lemon pie’ tastes like styrofoam
news.summary: Every so often a new restaurant lands in our fair city and it’s treated like the arrival of the messiah. Of course I get the invitations to participate, but do I really want a ‘hard hat’ tour of the fit-out?
